verses.text: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

Twenty years old \add was\add* Ahaz when he began to reign , and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem , and did not \add that which was\add* right in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God , like David his father.

But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel , yea, and made his son to pass through the fire , according to the abominations of the heathen , whom the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* cast out from before the children of Israel.
And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places , and on the hills , and under every green tree. \p
¶ Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war : and they besieged Ahaz , but could not overcome \add him\add*.

At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria , and drave the Jews from Elath : and the Syrians came to Elath , and dwelt there unto this day.\f + \fr 16.6 \ft from Elath: Heb. from Eloth\f*

So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria , saying , I \add am\add* thy servant and thy son : come up , and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria , and out of the hand of the king of Israel , which rise up against me.

And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and in the treasures of the king’s house , and sent \add it for\add* a present to the king of Assyria.

And the king of Assyria hearkened unto him: for the king of Assyria went up against Damascus , and took it, and carried \add the people of\add* it captive to Kir , and slew Rezin.\f + \fr 16.9 \ft Damascus: Heb. Dammesek\f* \p

¶ And king Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria , and saw an altar that \add was\add* at Damascus : and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the fashion of the altar , and the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship thereof.\f + \fr 16.10 \ft Damascus: Heb. Dammesek\f*
And Urijah the priest built an altar according to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus : so Urijah the priest made \add it\add* against king Ahaz came from Damascus.
And when the king was come from Damascus , the king saw the altar : and the king approached to the altar , and offered thereon.

And he burnt his burnt offering and his meat offering , and poured his drink offering , and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings , upon the altar.\f + \fr 16.13 \ft his peace offerings: Heb. the peace offerings which were his\f*

And he brought also the brasen altar , which \add was\add* before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, from the forefront of the house , from between the altar and the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and put it on the north side of the altar.

And king Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest , saying , Upon the great altar burn the morning burnt offering , and the evening meat offering , and the king’s burnt sacrifice , and his meat offering , with the burnt offering of all the people of the land , and their meat offering , and their drink offerings ; and sprinkle upon it all the blood of the burnt offering , and all the blood of the sacrifice : and the brasen altar shall be for me to enquire \add by\add*.
Thus did Urijah the priest , according to all that king Ahaz commanded. \p

¶ And king Ahaz cut off the borders of the bases , and removed the laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen that \add were\add* under it, and put it upon a pavement of stones.
And the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the house , and the king’s entry without , turned he from the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* for the king of Assyria. \p
¶ Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did , \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah ?
And Ahaz slept with his fathers , and was buried with his fathers in the city of David : and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
